intro: Machaerina restioides, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its sword-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant is adapted to coastal environments and can thrive in sandy or gravelly soils. It plays an important role in the ecological and cultural heritage of New Zealand. Machaerina restioides is also valued for its historical use in traditional Māori weaving practices.
